definition[0]: used when you are adding a statement that says almost the opposite of what you have just said
example[0]: John might be ready to help us, but then again, he might not.
example[1]: You feel really sorry for him. But then again, it’s hard to like him.
definition[1]: used when you are adding a statement that makes what you have just said seem less surprising
example[2]: Dinah missed the last rehearsal, but then she always was unreliable, wasn’t she?
definition[2]: used to say that although something is true, something else is also true which makes the first thing seem less important
example[3]: William didn’t succeed first time, but then very few people do.
example[4]: Elaine’s father might lend them the money, but then again he might not.
